intro: Casearia albicaulis, commonly known as the white-stemmed casearia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, pale green stems and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. Its small, white flowers are clustered in terminal inflorescences, and it produces small, smooth, yellowish fruits. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
